channel.title: International: Top News And Analysis
channel.description: CNBC International is the world leader for news on business, technology, China, trade, oil prices, the Middle East and markets.

item.title: CNBC's Inside India newsletter: India's central bank has a new governor. Three experts reveal what they'd do in his shoes
item.description: The move to replace Reserve Bank of India Governor Shaktikanta Das with Sanjay Malhotra appears a calculated way to address the weakness in India's economy.

item.title: China stresses plans to boost growth at top agenda-setting meeting
item.description: The annual economic work conference followed a high-level Monday meeting of the Politburo, the ruling Communist Party's top decision-making body.

item.title: Singapore workers are afraid to admit using AI at work, even as demand for AI talent surges
item.description: Demand for AI talent has surged in Singapore, but 45% of workers report feeling uncomfortable revealing they use the technology at work, according to Slack.

item.title: Investors were already wary of South Korean stocks. Then the country descended into chaos
item.description: The 'Korea discount' refers to South Korean securities trading at lower valuations relative to regional peers due to investors' concerns over issues such as corporate governance.

item.title: CNBC Daily Open: Inflation’s hot, but so are markets this year
item.description: It’s important to keep stocks’ performance this year in mind even as investors wonder what it’ll take to get inflation numbers lower.

item.title: Watch the full video of Donald Trump talking with Jim Cramer at the NYSE
item.description: President-elect Donald Trump rang the opening bell at the New York Stock Exchange on Thursday morning.

item.title: 33-year-old mom moved her family from Texas to an island in Greece: ‘Our life is just so much more fulfilling here’
item.description: After having her daughter, Cara West felt unsupported living in the U.S. She's on track to earn $136,000 as a travel concierge and content creator in Greece.

item.title: Broadcom shares rise 13% on profit beat, 'massive' opportunity in AI
item.description: Broadcom is seeing soaring demand from the boom in generative AI infrastructure.

item.title: Trump rings bell at NYSE to cheers of 'USA' as Wall Street CEOs, business leaders look on
item.description: President-elect Donald Trump, who seeks to attract and boost business in the U.S., was greeted with enthusiasm from the NYSE crowd.

item.title: Adobe shares suffer steepest drop in over two years on disappointing revenue guidance
item.description: Adobe shares tumbled after the software vendor issued revenue guidance that fell short of analysts' estimates.

item.title: ServiceTitan pops 42% in cloud software vendor’s Nasdaq debut after selling shares at $71
item.description: In the first notable venture-backed tech IPO since April, ServiceTitan shares jumped after the cloud software company raised about $625 million in its offering.

item.title: Wholesale prices rose 0.4% in November, more than expected
item.description: The producer price index was expected to increase 0.2% in November, according to the Dow Jones consensus estimate.

item.title: UK and EU leaders want a reset after Trump's win — and now voters want it too
item.description: As U.K. and EU leaders seek to reset relations ahead of President-elect Donald Trump's return to the White House, public sentiment also appears to be shifting.

item.title: Greece's ghost towns offer a glimpse of a country struggling with 'existential' population collapse
item.description: Years of declining births, economic hardship and mass emigration have left huge swathes of Greece vacant, creating fresh concerns for the country.

item.title: Swiss National Bank takes leap with 50-basis-point interest rate cut amid franc strength
item.description: The Swiss National Bank on Thursday cut its key interest rate by 50 basis points, exceeding expectations of a smaller trim.

item.title: China's monetary shift signals economic worries, but 'bazooka-style' stimulus is unlikely, experts say
item.description: Despite a flurry of stimulus measures, recent economic indicators have showed the world's second-largest economy is still struggling with deflationary pressures.

item.title: Indian outbound travel will be ‘the story’ of the next decade, says Hilton executive
item.description: Indian travelers spent $34 billion on outbound travel in 2023. That's "minuscule" compared to what's to come, said Alan Watts, Hilton's Asia-Pacific president.

item.title: SpaceX valuation surges to $350 billion as company buys back stock
item.description: The valuation of Elon Musk's SpaceX hit $350 billion based on a secondary share sale, CNBC confirmed Wednesday.

item.title: Murder suspect Luigi Mangione's notebook called 'wack' of CEO 'targeted, precise'
item.description: Luigi Mangione has refused to waive extradition to New York, where the Penn grad is charged with murdering UnitedHealthcare CEO Brian Thompson.

item.title: Budget deficit swells in November, pushing fiscal 2025 shortfall 64% higher than a year ago
item.description: For the month, the deficit totaled $366.8 billion, 17% higher than November 2023

item.title: European Central Bank heads for last rate cut of year — but jumbo move seems off the table
item.description: The euro zone central bank will need to do "heavy lifting" next year to support the waning economy, analysts say.

item.title: Annual inflation rate accelerates to 2.7% in November, as expected
item.description: The consumer price index was expected to rise 0.3% in November and 2.7% from a year ago.

item.title: Tesla shares close at record high, boosted by 69% pop since Trump election victory
item.description: Tesla's stock topped its 2021 high on Wednesday, as investor optimism increases heading into Donald Trump's return to the White House.

item.title: Trump's White House return is already pushing Europe and the UK closer together
item.description: U.K. Chancellor Rachel Reeves travelled to Brussels on Monday to convene with her EU counterparts in the first such encounter since Britain left the European Union.

item.title: NFL approves sale of minority stake in the Philadelphia Eagles at $8.3 billion value
item.description: The National Football league has approved the sale of a minority stake in the Philadelphia Eagles to two family investment groups.

item.title: Auto giants endured a torrid time of it this year — and few expect 2025 to be much better
item.description: A perfect storm of challenges for the European automobile industry shows no sign of letting up, analysts say.

item.title: JetBlue to bring 'junior Mint' first class to domestic flights in 2026
item.description: JetBlue plans to add domestic first-class seats in a two-by-two configuration for shorter flights in 2026.

item.title: Apple launches its ChatGPT integration with Siri
item.description: Apple released new versions of its iPhone, iPad, and Mac software on Wednesday that include the long-awaited ChatGPT integration with Siri.

item.title: The CPI report Wednesday is expected to show that progress on inflation has hit a wall
item.description: The consumer price index is expected to show a 2.7% 12-month inflation rate for November.

item.title: Macy's employee who hid $151 million in delivery expenses was trying to mask initial mistake, sources say
item.description: The department store operator slightly raised its full-year forecast, while still projecting a sales decline.
